intro: Notopleura hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduras notopleura, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, palmate leaves. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it typically blooms during the dry season. Notopleura hondurensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
